title: Morning Digest: India rides on Jemimah’s knock to reach WC final; King Charles strips brother Andrew of titles and mansion, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

title: Trump hosts White House Halloween bash with superheroes, presidential lookalikes amid shutdown
description: President Trump first lady Melania Trump and handed out full-sized Hershey bars and Twizzlers in boxes with the presidential seal to a line of children and their parents that stretched down the driveway

title: In the age of AI-doctored videos, find wonder in what is real
Ritwik Ghatak centenary | Excerpt from Unmechanical, ed. Shamya Dasgupta
description: Enfant terrible of Bengali cinema, Ritwik Ghatak, who would have turned 100 on November 4, bent every rule in the book

title: According to a survey of 25 countries, Indians are least aware of AI
description: Despite low awareness, Indians expressed the most confidence in government regulation

title: Extending PM-Poshan to include breakfast will help align national policy with nutritional and educational realities
Express view on de-escalation of China-US trade war: A thaw, an opening
Trump-Xi meeting: Washington-Beijing rivalry is more than a tale of rise and decline — it’s a mirror of two nations wrestling to determine the next global order
Aland ‘vote chori’: SIT cites CCTV footage from ex-BJP MLA’s home
Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Jayanti 2025: Are banks open or closed today, October 31, for National Unity Day?
October 31, 1985, Forty Years Ago: Homage to Indira
Devastated Caribbean assesses damage as hurricane Melissa eyes Bermuda
description: Hurricane Melissa smashed into both Jamaica and Cuba with enormous force, and residents were assessing their losses and the long road to recovery.

title: Fate of thousands feared in Darfur after reported rampage by Sudanese paramilitary force
description: Aid workers are concerned that only a few people fleeing the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces in Sudan’s Darfur region have reached safety

title: Indian-origin man fatally attacked after confronting stranger urinating on his car in Canada
description: The victim, identified as Arvi Singh Sagoo, succumbed to his injuries five days later, the Edmonton Police Service said in a statement

title: Watch: Pure moments of joy! Jemimah Rodrigues hugs family after innings of a lifetime
description: Jemimah Rodrigues' record-breaking century against Australia propelled India into the ICC Women's World Cup final. The emotional victory was marked by a tearful embrace with her parents, a moment of profound joy and redemption for Rodrigues, who battled anxiety throughout the tour. Her faith and resolve guided her match-winning performance.

title: Four Republicans back Senate resolution to undo Trump's tariffs around globe
description: Sen. Rand Paul, a Kentucky Republican who backed Democrats on the resolutions, credited Mr. Trump for decreasing the tariffs on China, but said the result is “still much higher than we've had.” “It still will lead to increased prices,” he said.

title: Owners to be fined for unlicensed pets, ones without collars from November 24
Diwali diyas make way for Halloween costumes in spooky season
DU cancels talk in its sociology colloquium series, cites lack of approval
One-year limit lifted for deregistered vehicles to obtain NOC
Delhi’s AQI up by nearly 100 points in a day, highest in October in 3 years
Two pollution watchdogs, same STPs, very different readings
Adoor Gopalakrishnan: To Ritwik Ghatak, with love
description: Ghatak had no competitors, not even imitators, says the acclaimed filmmaker from Kerala about his professor at FTII and one of the greatest figures in Indian cinema

title: How Ritwik Ghatak’s films showed Calcutta as a place of hope and refuge for migrants
description: To Ghatak, the city was also a character, and one different from the Calcutta in Satyajit Ray or Mrinal Sen’s films

title: Infant rescued from childless couple in Delhi; 2 juveniles among five held
Women’s ODI World Cup | I didn’t play for my hundred — I played to see India win: Jemimah Rodrigues
description: When I came into this World Cup, having been dropped from the last one, I didn’t want to prove a point,” Jemimah Rodrigues said. “I just wanted to make sure India wins. Because it’s easy to get into that mindset of proving yourself — and that mindset never helps me.”

title: Delhi Jal Board appoints KPMG as project management unit
Immediately appoint officer for inquiry against 9 suspended Tihar officials accused of extortion: HC to govt
Cyclone Montha | Ministers Ponnam, Tummala assure relief to farmers who suffered crop loss
description: Centre should declare damage caused by unprecedented rainfall in Telangana a natural calamity and extend help to mitigate woes of rain-affected people, says Ponnam Prabhakar

title: Meetings held, wards get in-charges: Delhi BJP gears up for MCD bypolls
Delhi | From Rs 10 lakh to 1 lakh: Floor lowered for cyber fraud e-FIR
Govt to host food festival to celebrate foundation day of Delhi, 9 other states
Minting a murder | Review of The Hallmarked Man by Robert Galbraith
description: A decade on, Galbraith aka J.K. Rowling is still going strong with her Strike series. However, the magic is wearing off

title: Karnataka jealous of Andhra Pradesh’s rise, says BJP leader
description: “The Congress cannot digest India’s growth. The comments made by Karnataka Minister M.B. Patil shows their frustration and jealousy,” said Sadineni Yamini Sarma

Malala Yousafzai: "Someone asked me if getting shot was a blessing in disguise."
description: Ahead of the release of her new memoir, the Nobel laureate talks about her years in Oxford, marriage and self-discovery

title: Women's WC: 'Dho Dala!' - Sehwag hails India's dazzling win over Australia in semifinal
description: India's women's cricket team achieved a historic five-wicket victory over Australia, securing a spot in the World Cup final. Jemimah Rodrigues' unbeaten 127 and Harmanpreet Kaur's 89 were pivotal in their record-breaking chase of 339. Virender Sehwag lauded the team's fearless performance, stating they 'dho daala' all criticism with their spectacular win.

title: Education officer in Faridabad retracts letter flagging ‘love jihad’ by students; ‘clerical error’ cited
Karnataka to seek ₹1,545 crore from Centre from NDRF for losses during Southwest Monsoon
description: Though the actual damage of infrastructure is more than ₹ 5,000 crores in Karnataka, we have sought ₹ 1,545 crores as per the NDRF norms: H.K. Patil

title: California museum’s collection looted: Over 1,000 items stolen in early morning heist
'Based on mutual respect': Pak, Afghanistan agree to truce after talks; follow-up meet on Nov 6
description: Pakistan and Afghanistan have agreed to uphold a ceasefire during peace talks in Istanbul, following recent deadly military confrontations. Turkey announced the agreement, with a follow-up meeting scheduled for November 6 to determine implementation. Both nations seek lasting peace based on mutual respect and non-interference, though Pakistan warned against cross-border terrorism.

title: Corporation launches 15-cr. initiative to repair roads in various zones
description: A contingency of up to 25% has been allocated to contractors. Work is under way on over 500 roads, N. Chitrarasu, chairperson of Standing Committee (Works), said at the Council meeting

title: Scientists detect early brain response to rhythm in preterm babies
description: Researchers using near-infrared brain imaging found that rhythmic sounds activate both auditory and motor regions in premature infants, indicating that rhythm processing begins before full-term birth and helps wire early pathways for learning and coordination

title: ‘America First’ Trump loved hanging out with the global elite during his Asia trip
Tears, Hugs and a Flying Kiss: India's emotional celebrations after beating Australia – Watch
description: India achieved a historic five-wicket victory over defending champions Australia in the ICC Women's World Cup semi0final match, chasing a record 339. Jemimah Rodrigues' unbeaten 127 anchored the monumental chase, supported by Harmanpreet Kaur's aggressive 89. This triumph marked redemption for years of near-misses and secured India's spot in the final.

title: Trump hosts White House Halloween bash with superheroes and presidential lookalikes amid shutdown
Govt. buildings exempt from fine for delayed tax payment
description: Traders demand similar exemption from penal interest for delayed payment of property tax in Chennai

title: Puducherry businessman murdered in Ashok Nagar by his employee’s husband
Mamata urges people not to get provoked by SIR, says no legitimate citizen will be left out
description: The West Bengal Chief Minister who had dubbed the SIR as National Register of Citizens through back door, reiterated that her government “will not allow NRC to be implemented in Bengal — neither through the front door, nor through the back door”

title: Exclusive: 'Zid' and 'junoon' of Mohammed Shami - The man who refuses to give up
description: Apart from moving the ball both ways, Mohammed Shami also has two ingrained ingredients in him -- "zid" to prove everyone wrong and "junoon" to prove himself again, and again. These have kept Shami going despite facing rejection from his home state Uttar Pradesh in his teens, a knee surgery that almost ended his career, a near-death experience in a road accident, suicidal thoughts during personal crisis, vitriolic trolling after losing to Pakistan, and several other roadblocks.

title: The triumph of dharma
Rahul’s Chhath comment against Modi reflects his values and upbringing: Nadda
description: The Congress leader claimed that the Prime Minister would do "anything for votes, even dance"

title: Bihar polls: NDA set for manifesto launch; focus on creating jobs in IT, MSME sectors
description: The NDA is set to unveil its election manifesto, prioritizing job creation in IT, semiconductors, and MSMEs, offering a distinct alternative to the opposition's focus on government jobs. This strategy aims to leverage local talent and address migration concerns by fostering private sector growth, acknowledging Bihar's current limitations in attracting large manufacturing units.

title: Palestinian militants hand over remains of two more hostages to Red Cross in Gaza
description: Hamas has now returned the remains of 17 hostages since the start of the ceasefire, with 11 others still in Gaza and set to be turned over under the terms of the agreement

title: 'Some Indian companies': China OKs supply of rare earth magnets to India; what MEA said
description: India has secured approval for some domestic companies to import crucial rare earth magnets from China, vital for automotive and electronics sectors. These licenses follow earlier curbs, enabling access to materials essential for electric vehicles and other high-tech products. However, imports are restricted, prohibiting use in defense and export to the US.

title: 'I love Muhammad': 5 write slogans on temples to frame Muslims; 4 held
description: Four men were arrested in Aligarh for allegedly defacing temple walls with "I love Muhammad" graffiti to frame their Muslim neighbors in a property dispute. Police identified the suspects, noting misspelled slogans that differed from previous protests, leading to their apprehension through technical surveillance. The accused have been jailed under BNS.

title: The internal rewiring of a grand old party: Congress focuses on DCCs for revival
description: As part of its newly launched leadership selection programme, Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan, the Congress is banking on empowered district-level leadership. After extensive screening and consultations, the 139-year-old party will appoint District Congress Committee presidents through a merit-based process across States. Sandeep Phukan explores the process and the criticism

title: MDU staff ‘force’ women to click photo of private parts as period proof, booked
Anti-fire cables, accessible panic buttons among recommendations for Vande Bharat sleeper train
4 on death row for CRPF terror attack acquitted; court cites lack of proof
description: Allahabad High Court acquitted four men, including two Pakistani nationals, of terrorism charges in a 2007 attack that killed eight CRPF personnel. The court cited prosecution's failure to prove culpability beyond reasonable doubt, instead convicting them under the Arms Act and sentencing them to 10 years rigorous imprisonment. Families of victims expressed anger and disbelief at the verdict.

title: Rahul Gandhi: PM lacks courage to take on Trump over ceasefire claim
Govt to bring law against substandard pesticides and seeds: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
3-day RSS executive body meeting begins in Jabalpur: Centenary events, national issues on agenda
17 kids rescued, man shot dead after Mumbai studio hostage drama
Delhi Confidential: All Caps
US waives sanctions on Chabahar port till April; key to India’s access to Afganistan, Central Asia
description: The United States has granted a six-month extension to the sanctions waiver for India's Chabahar port in Iran. This crucial development allows India continued access to Afghanistan and Central Asia, bypassing Pakistan. The port's importance for India's economic ties with Afghanistan is highlighted amidst evolving regional dynamics.

title: Ahead of COP30, UNEP flags widening climate adaptation finance gap
description: Developing countries will require between $310 billion and $365 billion annually by 2035 to adapt to climate change, current international public adaptation finance flows stand at $26 billion

title: Government relaxes green cover norms for industrial projects
description: Against a 33% green cover mandated earlier, industrial estates can earmark 10% for plantation while individual industries can have 15% greenbelt in their respective project areas

title: Daily Horoscope for October 31, 2025: Astrological Forecasts for Libra, Leo, Pisces, Aries, Sagittarius, and All Zodiac Signs
A hundred years ago | Javanese drama
Kanpur: Man killed over Rs 40 lakh insurance money; mother among 3 held
description: A 47-year-old widow was arrested for allegedly conspiring with her lover and his brother to murder her 22-year-old son. The trio reportedly killed Pradeep Sharma to claim Rs 40 lakh from four life insurance policies taken in his name. The victim's body was staged as a road accident.

title: Chargesheet submitted in gang-rape of medical college student in West Bengal’s Durgapur
description: The chargesheet comes after 20 days of the horrific crime; charges have been pressed against the six accused for rape, gangrape, extortion, dacoity among other sections of BNS

title: TOI Imapact: NHAI simplifies process to complete KYV for FASTags
description: The National Highways Authority of India has simplified the Know Your Vehicle (KYV) process for FASTags, removing the need for side vehicle photographs. Users can now upload only a front picture of their number plate and FASTag.

title: 300 underprivileged kids from Pune enjoy a day out at Women’s World Cup semifinal
description: The group — comprising students aged between eight and fifteen — travelled from Pune as part of a special initiative led by Shashank Wagh, a 68-year-old senior citizen

title: Satara doctor’s death: kin raise suspicions
description: Family of the 28-year-old woman doctor claimed there were discrepancies in the autopsy report and demanded a probe into the case

title: Stefon Diggs responds with cryptic message after K’yanna Barber pregnancy rumors
description: Star player Stefon Diggs faces allegations of another pregnancy while Cardi B is expecting. DJ Akademiks posted about K'yanna Barber's pregnancy, linking it to Diggs. Diggs has remained silent on both situations. Fans are concerned for Cardi B given past marital issues. Diggs posted a quote about not talking too much, fueling speculation.

title: Fifty years ago | Participation by workers at shop floor level
Review Akola order against secular policy: Maha to Supreme Court
description: Maharashtra government has approached the Supreme Court seeking a review of its order to form a special investigation team for Akola riot cases, comprising police officials from both Hindu and Muslim communities. The state argues that dividing the police force on religious lines contradicts the nation's secular policies and undermines the neutrality of law enforcement officers.

title: ‘Baseless and anti-development’: ICAR slams GM-Free India’s claims on rice data
Childless couple, woman held for kidnapping infant, 2 juveniles detained
De’Aaron Fox out as Spurs face setback ahead of Miami Heat clash tonight
description: The San Antonio Spurs are facing injury concerns as De'Aaron Fox, their $229 million acquisition, is sidelined with a hamstring injury. This has led to increased playing time for rookies Dylan Harper and Stephon Castle. Despite Fox's absence, the Spurs have started the season strong, winning their first three games.

title: ‘Communists wouldn’t come back to power in Tripura even in 2088’: BJP MP Biplab Deb
IIT Delhi study reveals security gap in Android apps that use location
‘Display of ignorance, political opportunism’: Pradhan slams Priyanka’s remarks on NEP, PM-SHRI
Brittany Mahomes and Patrick Mahomes rumored to sway Taylor Swift’s politics
description: Taylor Swift's fanbase is divided over her perceived shift away from activism. While some fans lament a perceived "political glow-down" post-Joe Alwyn, others defend her right to privacy. Her "activist era" saw her endorse candidates and advocate for rights, but current associations are drawing criticism, sparking debate on celebrity responsibility versus personal choice.

title: DUSIB floats tenders for 54 Atal Canteens
Epstein files: King Charles strips Prince Andrew of all titles; evicts him from Windsor home
description: King Charles has stripped Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and ordered him to leave his Windsor residence. This decision follows weeks of pressure and Andrew's earlier relinquishment of the Duke of York title due to his association with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Faith, fire, folded hands and a flying kiss: Jemimah Rodrigues stuns Australia in historic WC semifinal
description: Panned a lot for not living up to the lofty expectations from her, the Mumbai girl's 127 in a world record chase would be remembered till time immemorial.

description: Only CNG, LNG, electric vehicles and those compliant with BS-VI norms to be allowed into Delhi from November 1; govt. lifts one-year limit on NOC applications for deregistered vehicles; move will help in reducing pollution, says Transport Minister

title: DU faces backlash over bid to promotecow welfare summit

description: A palace source said that while Andrew continued to deny the accusations against him, it was clear that there had been serious lapses of judgement

title: ICE operations in Chicago will continue during Halloween, says Kristi Noem
After 15 yrs in jail, couple serving life for murder gets parole for IVF
description: A Gujarat High Court has granted extended parole to a couple convicted of murder, allowing them to undergo IVF treatment. Jayendra Damor and Sejal Bariya, serving life sentences for a 2010 killing, received a rare judicial allowance to pursue parenthood while incarcerated. The court emphasized their surrender after the parole period concludes.

title: Should AI be introduced as part of school curricula?
UP woman gets 3.5 years' jail for false SC/ST Act plaint
description: A Lucknow court convicted a woman for a false SC/ST Act complaint, sentencing her to 3.5 years in jail. The ruling stated compensation under the Act will only be considered after a chargesheet and prima facie case, not just FIR registration. This aims to curb misuse of the law for financial gain.

title: ASUSE, PLFS to help estimate District Domestic Product; working with states: MoSPI Secretary

Telangana: Cyclone Montha leaves 6 dead; one missing
description: Cyclone Montha brought torrential rain to Telangana, causing at least six deaths across 12 districts. Flooding inundated homes, toppled trees, and disrupted transport. Warangal and Hanumakonda experienced record rainfall, with victims including a bedridden man drowned in his home and an auto-rickshaw driver swept away by floodwaters.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment centered on daughter Gianna
description: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

description: From being the most feared batter in the 20-over game, there has been a dramatic, alarming fall from grace; his knock in the first T20I against Australia in Canberra showed that he was back in breathtaking run-making mood

title: 3I ATLAS detected sending Fibonacci pulse signal at 1420 MHz
description: Scientists are investigating a mysterious pulse signal from interstellar object 3I/ATLAS. The signal reportedly follows a Fibonacci pattern and is detected at a frequency linked to interstellar communication. Researchers are cautiously exploring the possibility of an intelligent transmission. This discovery has sparked global curiosity about extraterrestrial life and potential signals from space.

title: ​Out of the fortress: On protecting India‘s tigers
description: Tiger conservation policy rightly sees people as stakeholders, not trespassers

title: Woman dies, 3 others injured as fire breaks out in house

description: The process of learning a language will outlast every technological revolution

Gabrielle Union tears up as Kaavia shares heartfelt message on her 53rd birthday
description: Gabrielle Union, celebrating her 53rd birthday while filming in Rome, was deeply moved by a touching throwback Instagram post from her daughter Kaavia. The heartfelt message, shared by Kaavia, brought Gabrielle to tears, highlighting the enduring power of love despite distance. Gabrielle Union is currently filming for her upcoming project in Rome.

title: Australian mental health startup launches app
Family of three rescued from floodwaters of Sarada river
Fisherfolk in Machilipatnam reel under livelihood loss due to cyclone
description: Many fisherfolk have been out of work for the past one week as warning came right after Deepavali, forcing them to borrow money from boat owners to run their families, forcing them deeper into the debt trap

title: ‘Last 4 months have been really hard’: Jemimah breaks down after win
description: Jemimah Rodrigues delivered a match-winning unbeaten 127, guiding India to a record ODI chase of 339 against Australia. This victory secured India's spot in the Women's World Cup final. Rodrigues expressed deep gratitude for her faith and support system. The team's remarkable performance overcame a challenging situation, setting up a historic win.

title: Clash between Jan Suraaj Party, JD(U) supporters in Bihar leaves one dead, several injured

US to accept only 7,500 refugees a year, with majority being white South Africans
Union Minister George Kurian calls for development beyond politics
description: Foundation stone laid for new academic block at the Central University of Kerala, Periya Campus

title: Paralysis cure? Old drug found to help regenerate spinal cord cells
description: A groundbreaking study from UC San Diego has identified Thiorphan, an existing drug, as a potential game-changer for spinal cord injuries. Researchers used advanced bioinformatics to discover its ability to stimulate nerve regrowth and restore motor function in animal models. This discovery offers significant hope for reversing paralysis, with human trials anticipated.

title: Plea to implement TAEI at Tirumanagalam GH
description: Tirumangalam government hospital receives a significantly higher number of patients compared to Melur government hospital. However, the hospital lacked adequate infrastructure and critical need for emergency care services and specialised medical equipment and trained doctors to handle trauma cases, says the petitioner

title: 13-year-old girl swept away in stream at Padmanabham
CM, Deputy CM commend India's 90th chess grandmaster
CM’s welfare announcements lack sincerity, says KPCC chief
IIT-Madras researchers achieve ‘soft landing’ for vertical take-off aircraft and UAVs
description: Combining real-time hybrid rocket thruster with a virtual simulation, the researchers “achieved the necessary velocity for soft landing, a crucial feature for all craft ranging from planetary landing of unmanned or manned exploration module to terrestrial landing of a VTOL (vertical take-off and landing) aircraft”.

title: Delhi High Court rejects PIL against the release of The Taj Story
description: The PIL had challenged the CBFC’s certification of the film, alleging that the movie was based on fabricated facts, and pushed a particular political narrative that could disturb communal harmony

title: How Kerala eradicated extreme poverty
description: On November 1, the Kerala government is set to declare the State extreme poverty-free, the culmination of a four-year-long strenuous exercise. Four lakh enumerators fanned out across the State and identified the most marginalised. The local bodies then devised micro-plans to suit each family. The government claims that the programme uplifted 1,03,099 people from extreme poverty. S.R. Praveen interacts with some of the beneficiaries and also listens to dissenting voices

title: Dolly workers arrested for defrauding Sabarimala pilgrims

description: Palaniswami accuses Sengottaiyan of working against the AIADMK for long, and vows action against him. He holds him responsible for the party’s defeat in Anthiyur in the 2021 Assembly election

title: Rs 8 lakh cash deposited in bank - man gets tax notice! How he won case in ITAT
description: A taxpayer successfully challenged the tax department's decision to treat a large cash deposit as presumptive business income. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled that the Assessing Officer exceeded his jurisdiction by expanding a limited scrutiny case without proper approval, reinforcing taxpayer rights.

title: HYDRAA reclaims government lands

Umashree to receive Dr. Rajkumar Award for lifetime achievement in Kannada cinema
description: Veteran film and theatre person Umashree has been chosen for Dr. Rajkumar Award for lifetime achievement in Kannada cinema

title: ED seizes ₹3 crore in Kolkata municipal recruitment scam

title: HC directs Kerala govt. to complete steps to table anti-ragging Bill
Golden State Warriors vs Milwaukee Bucks injury report: who’s in, who’s out
description: The Golden State Warriors face the Milwaukee Bucks in a highly anticipated early-season clash. Despite some injuries, both teams boast championship talent. Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler are healthy for the Warriors, while Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable for the Bucks. Expect a tactical battle with key matchups defining the outcome.

Sardar Patel’s vision and the meaning of national unity today
description: Unity, Patel taught us, is a task renewed in every generation. It must be defended against the fragmenting impulses of indifference, ignorance and regionalism

Arya, claiming he only wanted a conversation, was shot after allegedly attempting to harm the children with an air gun. He later died in hospital. Police successfully rescued all hostages.

description: India's Smriti Mandhana was controversially dismissed for 24 in the World Cup semi-final against Australia. A late DRS review, initiated with seconds to spare, showed a spike on UltraEdge despite Mandhana's clear belief of no contact. This crucial wicket, at a critical juncture of the challenging chase, significantly impacted India's momentum.

However, he failed to provide supporting evidence, leading to the suspension and forfeiture of his results.

title: 'Can't break deal': Pak says 'US drones behind Afghan strikes'; makes shocking admission
description: Pakistan has admitted to a US drone agreement during Pakistan-Afghanistan peace talks, causing Afghan negotiators to demand written guarantees against drone use in their airspace. The talks collapsed as Pakistan blamed Kabul for refusing to act against militants, with Islamabad vowing to protect its people from terrorism.

title: Racy clips & blackmail: Inside cold-blooded 'live-in murders'; what's pushing partners to kill?
description: Once a symbol of freedom, live-in relationships in India are now linked to chilling incidents of betrayal, violence, and death. From brutal murders to gruesome dismemberment, recent cases highlight a disturbing trend where possessiveness and jealousy escalate into extreme violence, challenging societal norms and legal interpretations.

title: Stefon Diggs linked to Drake’s ‘Kiki’ pregnancy while expecting with Cardi B
description: A shocking rumour has emerged concerning NFL star Stefon Diggs.  While Cardi B is confirmed to be pregnant with his child, DJ Akademiks alleges Diggs also got K'yanna Barber pregnant. Barber is famously known as 'Kiki' from Drake's hit song 'In My Feelings'. This news has sparked widespread online discussion and memes.
